summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, transmitting a batch of discovery materials. The materials include photographs and documents regarding victims not referenced in the indictment, designated as confidential under a protective order.

events.title: Court Order for Discovery Disclosure
events.description: The court issued an order directing the government to disclose certain discovery materials by March 12, 2021.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case governing the handling of confidential materials.

events.title: Government Produces Discovery
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials, including photographs and documents regarding victims not in the indictment, to the defense.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case on March 12, 2021, in compliance with a court order.
The produced materials included photographs and documents regarding victims who were not referenced in the indictment (No. S1 20 Cr. 330).
The materials were designated as 'confidential' under a protective order dated July 31, 2020.
The production was sent to multiple defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell.
The document confirms the ongoing discovery obligations of the government in the criminal case.
